H0.text: Homologous tissues are those that will become the scrotum in a male and the labia in a female, thus they are regarded as having a homologous relationship.

H1.text: Opposite is the relationship between the tissue that becomes the scrotum in a male and the tissue that becomes the labia in a female.

H2.text: Symbiotic is the relationship that the tissue becoming the scrotum in a male also becomes the labia in a female.

H3.text: Mutual is the relationship that the tissue which becomes the scrotum in a male also becomes the labia in a female.

A4.text: The scrotum is homologous to the labia majora in females.
